intro: Ligulariopsis shichuana, commonly known as the Shichuan water starwort, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Hydrocharitaceae and is characterized by its submerged, branching stems and small, spirally arranged leaves. The plant typically grows in freshwater habitats such as ponds and lakes, where it forms dense underwater vegetation. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often floating at the water's surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
